item.title: Texas Expedites Help From Out-Of-State Health Care Providers
item.description: September 1, 2017 - As the medical and mental health needs of people affected by Harvey become apparent, Texas has made it easier for out-of-state health workers to come lend a hand.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 1, 2017 - As the medical and mental health needs of people affected by Harvey become apparent, Texas has made it easier for out-of-state health workers to come lend a hand. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/01/547816150/texas-expedites-help-from-out-of-state-health-care-providers

item.title: What Is 'Fruit Concentrate,' Anyway? And Is It Good For You?
item.description:
September 1, 2017 - The mystery ingredient pops up in a lot of household favorites, but its nutrition level depends on how it's used.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/09/01/545336956/what-is-fruit-concentrate-anyway-and-is-it-good-for-you
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 1, 2017 - The mystery ingredient pops up in a lot of household favorites, but its nutrition level depends on how it's used. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/09/01/545336956/what-is-fruit-concentrate-anyway-and-is-it-good-for-you

item.title: A Father To His Son: 'I Know What It's Like' Living With Tourette's Syndrome
item.description: September 1, 2017 - Josh Hanagarne has an extreme form of Tourette's syndrome, where his tics — or involuntary movements and sounds — have been so severe, they've put him in the hospital.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 1, 2017 - Josh Hanagarne has an extreme form of Tourette's syndrome, where his tics — or involuntary movements and sounds — have been so severe, they've put him in the hospital. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/01/547412867/a-father-to-his-son-i-know-what-it-s-like-living-with-tourette-s-syndrome

item.title: For Grocery Stores In Texas, It's A Race To Restock Their Shelves
item.description: August 31, 2017 - Hurricane Harvey destroyed intricate supply chains that keep supermarket shelves stocked with perishable food. Grocery stores are already rebuilding those networks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - Hurricane Harvey destroyed intricate supply chains that keep supermarket shelves stocked with perishable food. Grocery stores are already rebuilding those networks. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/08/31/547596372/for-grocery-stores-in-texas-its-a-race-to-restock-the-shelves

item.title: Why Some Muslims In Pakistan Won't Be Able To Buy A Goat This Year
item.description: August 31, 2017 - Buying a sacrificial goat for the Muslim holiday of Eid l-Adha is the sign of a strong household. But harsh droughts in the Karachi area are making it hard for families to afford one.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - Buying a sacrificial goat for the Muslim holiday of Eid l-Adha is the sign of a strong household. But harsh droughts in the Karachi area are making it hard for families to afford one. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/31/547286796/why-some-muslims-in-pakistan-wont-be-able-to-buy-a-goat-this-year

item.title: An 'Army Of People' Helps Houston Cancer Patients Get Treatment
item.description: August 31, 2017 - During Harvey, doctors, nurses, technicians and facilities staff tended to inpatients at MD Anderson Cancer Center. Now the hospital is working to get outpatients back for care as well.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - During Harvey, doctors, nurses, technicians and facilities staff tended to inpatients at MD Anderson Cancer Center. Now the hospital is working to get outpatients back for care as well. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/31/547539504/an-army-of-people-helps-houston-cancer-patients-get-treatment

item.title: Ants, Seaweed, Chocolate Beer And (Maybe) Less Meat: The Future Of Food
item.description: August 31, 2017 - When it comes to finding and preparing food, we're a continually inventive species. Anthropologist Barbara J. King asks: What are the food trends of the future?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - When it comes to finding and preparing food, we're a continually inventive species. Anthropologist Barbara J. King asks: What are the food trends of the future? http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/31/547550216/ants-seaweed-chocolate-beer-and-maybe-less-meat-the-future-of-food

item.title: Many People Can Delay Treatment For Thyroid Cancer, Study Finds
item.description: August 31, 2017 - After five years, just 12 percent of people diagnosed with papillary thyroid cancer saw their tumors grow by 3 millimeters or more, a study found. And in some people, the tumors shrank.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - After five years, just 12 percent of people diagnosed with papillary thyroid cancer saw their tumors grow by 3 millimeters or more, a study found. And in some people, the tumors shrank. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/31/547524399/people-can-delay-treatment-for-thyroid-cancer-study-finds

item.title: The Smartphone Generation: Less Sex, Fewer Drinks, More Depression
item.description:
August 31, 2017 - A psychologist worries that thousands of young people are "on the brink of a mental health crisis."
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-08-31/has-the-smartphone-destroyed-a-generation
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - A psychologist worries that thousands of young people are "on the brink of a mental health crisis." http://the1a.org/shows/2017-08-31/has-the-smartphone-destroyed-a-generation

item.title: Whatever Happened To ... The Surgeon Who Couldn't Count On Electricity?
item.description: August 31, 2017 - His goal: to perform surgery. The problem: power outages and finicky machines. We check back in with a doctor in Ghana.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - His goal: to perform surgery. The problem: power outages and finicky machines. We check back in with a doctor in Ghana. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/31/546997094/whatever-happened-to-the-surgeon-who-couldn-t-count-on-electricity

item.title: Fatherhood After 40? It's Becoming A Lot More Common
item.description: August 31, 2017 - The average age for fathers of newborns in the U.S. has risen from 27.4 years back in 1972 to 30.9 years now. And if the baby's dad has a college degree, he's likely to be even older.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - The average age for fathers of newborns in the U.S. has risen from 27.4 years back in 1972 to 30.9 years now. And if the baby's dad has a college degree, he's likely to be even older. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/31/547320586/fatherhood-after-forty-its-now-a-lot-more-common-study-finds

item.title: Live In Hawaii, And Odds Are You'll Need Fewer Prescription Meds
item.description: August 31, 2017 - People who live in the Aloha State are less likely to use opioid painkillers or be prescribed antibiotics than are mainland dwellers. Healthy lifestyles have a lot to do with that.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 31, 2017 - People who live in the Aloha State are less likely to use opioid painkillers or be prescribed antibiotics than are mainland dwellers. Healthy lifestyles have a lot to do with that. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/31/547317533/ornstein-it-s-better-in-hawaii

item.title: In Houston, Most Hospitals 'Up And Fully Functional'
item.description: August 30, 2017 - In the past few days, Southeast Texas' catastrophic medical operations center has faced challenges like it has never seen before in keeping the health care system functioning.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - In the past few days, Southeast Texas' catastrophic medical operations center has faced challenges like it has never seen before in keeping the health care system functioning. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/30/547327581/in-houston-most-hospitals-up-and-fully-functional

item.title: Whatever Happened To ... Those Farmers Who Needed Shoes?
item.description: August 30, 2017 - It was a mystery: How did farmers in Uganda contract a nightmare illness? A researcher found the answer. What's the best way to help them?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - It was a mystery: How did farmers in Uganda contract a nightmare illness? A researcher found the answer. What's the best way to help them? http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/30/547051705/whatever-happened-to-those-farmers-who-needed-shoes

item.title: Why The Toxin Trouble With Tiny Turtles Continues
item.description: August 30, 2017 - The government is warning people not to handle tiny turtles because of the risk of contracting salmonella. The problem is, it has been warning us for 40 years and we're still getting sick.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - The government is warning people not to handle tiny turtles because of the risk of contracting salmonella. The problem is, it has been warning us for 40 years and we're still getting sick. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/30/547305528/why-the-toxin-trouble-with-tiny-turtles-continues
